meanings.definition: the protective care or guardianship of someone or something
meanings.sent1: The puppy was in the custody of the kind animal shelter.
meanings.sent2: The mother held her baby in her custody, keeping him safe.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear took custody of the toy car to keep it from getting lost.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse stood in custody of the ships, guiding them safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The knight took custody of the princess, protecting her from danger.

meanings.definition: the legal right to make decisions about a child's welfare
